data.title: 3 Restaurant
data.text:
Join us for a complimentary music event at the bar/lounge.

Joshua David has been entertaining audiences with his unique blend of eclectic music since 2010.

His interest in guitar began at an early age, influenced by his Father, R.I. musician Curtis David.

At the age of 16, Joshua learned and mastered the guitar quickly and enjoyed playing many of his influences and idols of the music world including Neil Young, Eric Clapton, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd, Chris Stapleton, George Jones, and Johnny Cash …to name but a few.

Based out of Pawtucket, R.I., Joshua has performed at most of Pawtucket’s premier venues including Arigna Irish Pub, Murphy’s Law Irish Pub, Fountain Street Bar & Grille, & Boundary Brewhouse to name but a few and enjoys popularity at other venues in Rhode Island as well as Southeastern Mass.

In addition, Joshua has performed and produced the band Dr. Caligari’s Traveling Minstrel Show and is currently performing and producing the band Revival. See him on YouTube.

We are excited to announce the return of our famous Mother’s Day brunch buffet on Sunday, May 8th! Brunch will be served from 9:30am-2pm. Click here to view the Brunch menu. We are fully booked for brunch.

We will also be serving a plated dinner in our dining room on Mother’s Day from noon-7pm. Click here to view the dinner specials.

To make a reservation, please call 508-528-6333.

Join us for a complimentary music event at the bar/lounge.

One of the east coast’s steady rising talents. As an acoustic singer/songwriter Good Thomas’ guitar style resonates with the soft tones and nuances of James Taylor, Jim Croce and the likes. You’ll notice him utilising intricate finger style melodies effortlessly infused in unique percussive strumming patterns on his Martin guitar. His vocal wheel-house lies in warm, silky smooth tones often compared to Bread, Cat Stevens, Paul Simon and again James Taylor one of his biggest influences. Despite his affinity for 70s soft rock he is certainly not pigeon holed into any one genre. At his shows you’ll find a large range of genres and his repertoire pulls from all decades.

See him on YouTube

Join us for a complimentary music event at the bar/lounge.

New England’s newest singer-songwriter is at the forefront of the anti-folk sonic revival. Influenced by indie rock legends Neutral Milk Hotel and singer-songwriter Andy Shauf, Tom Abbott creates an immersive folk-punk experience for youthful rockers to enjoy. Through the grit of his vocals and jovial orchestral arrangements, Tom’s sound is the next step to rejuvenating the anti-folk genre. After serving as a guitarist for several alternative rock bands, he decided to go solo under his own name. Since then, the Boston-based artist has produced 3 full-length albums, been taught by iconic New England Conservatory musicians, and garnered attention from The Deli Magazine. Tom’s music is a “pristine example of New England’s rich folk-rock history” (The Deli Magazine).

See him on Youtube

As one of New England’s most celebrated entertainers, Joe Macey continues to raise the bar everywhere he performs. Joe has won numerous awards over the years and has been nominated many times from different media groups. As a singer songwriter, he recorded his only CD in 1995 at Studio C in Nashville TN, releasing his hit single “Lonesome Rider” world wide, and today remains his signature song which has sold over 50,000 certified units.

Macey has opened shows for country legends George Jones, Waylon Jennings and Charlie Daniels. He currently has over 20 national openers to his credit including American icons The Beach Boys, Grand Ole Opry star John Conlee, and Multi Award winning songwriter Phil Vassar. See him on YouTube. The show is complimentary, at the bar..

Join us for a complimentary music event at the bar/lounge.

The trio was established in the spring of 2016. Members Jessica Kelly, Jackie Turner and James Caruso had previously played together with Aid to Navigation (2008-2016). When the group parted ways, the J’s came together to form It’s a J Thing. The group has a dynamic sound boasting vocals from lead singer Jessica Kelly, a unique and powerful sound from Jackie Turner’s violin and a solid core established by the guitar and singing of James Caruso. The group mixes in original tunes with a wide variety of cover songs spanning any music lover’s catalog.

See him on YouTube.
